articleData.blog_content:
I am not ashamed of my body but growing up as an overweight child in 70s was brutal. Zero tolerance was not a thing, kudos to this child for being sensitive to others disabilities.

Though the adjective for women has changed from ˜charming to ˜intelligent and ˜logical in recent decades howbeit young girls often feel insecure when people question them about their weight and skin colour. This has emerged as the crux of anxiety and depression in them leading to unhealthy diet plans. Realising the same at a very early age, it was 10 years old Rhythm Pacheco who refused to attempt an offensive Maths Problem in her school class test which asked her to compare the weight of three women and determine how much heavier was Isabelle than Sue.

People often refuse to listen to their intuition but Rhythm being a 10-year-old girl stood up for her beliefs. Her concern for women who feel insecure about their bodies depicts that every individual needs to be vocal about their thoughts and stand for what is right. Needless to say but if we have youth like Rhythm, the future of this world is in right hands.
articleData.blog_headline: Each time a girl stands up for herself, she stands up for all women
